custom_fields.key_topics: The course will cover a new research topic each semester and the principles of the techniques used in that research.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Grades will be determined by attendance, quizzes, notebook record keeping, paper discussions, and a final presentation.
custom_fields.goals: You will be investigating a current biology problem. You will read literature articles, design hypothesis, plan and carry out experiments, analyze and interpret your data, and design future directions as part of a collaborative research team. Your team will communicate your results in an oral presentation to your peers and faculty.
custom_fields.relevance: This course will provide a laboratory experience that provides hands-on experimentation, data analysis and interpretation.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Students will be required to read the provided lab manual and provided scientific papers.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: In the spring semester, students are expected to participate in the Undergraduate Biology Laboratory Poster Session.

long_desc: In this handson laboratory class, students will investigate a current biology problem. Students will read literature articles, design hypotheses, plan and carry out experiments, analyze and interpret data, and design future questions as part of a collaborative research team.  In addition, teams will work with faculty and fellow students to understand and explore the relevance of their projects in the field of biology and other disciplines.  Finally, teams will communicate results in an oral presentation to peers and faculty. Students will gain research skills, analytical skills, communication skills both written and oral, and project design skills.

prereqs.text: (03-121 at least D) or (03-110 at least D) or (03-151 at least D)

name: Frontiers, Analysis, and Discovery in Biological Sciences
base_name: Frontiers, Analysis, and Discovery in Biological Sciences
